title: UK Safety Case Regulations Overview
content: The Offshore Installations (Safety Case) Regulations 2015 require duty holders to demonstrate MAH are managed to a level that is As Low As Reasonably Practicable (ALARP). Safety cases must address human and organizational factors. Inspectors assess HF integration across design, risk assessment, and management systems. Compliance isn't optionalâ€”it's regulatory.
